Cedric,

Good points.

1. I'm not used to the @BeforeClass. I will make tha=
t change, as it is a
better fit.
2. The assigning of nulls is just to empha=
size cleaning up after yourself. I
agree that it's technically unnecessary.=

3. Let me think about the parameterized thing. I think for eight values,
w=
ith their descriptive names, it brings more value leaving them as they are,=

although I may change where they are defined.

Thank you for you considere=
d points. Hopefully this will help us all sharpen
our JUnit writing.

Simon=



2010/8/22 C=C3=A9dric Beust =E2=99=94 <cedric@...>

>
>
> Hi Simon=
,
>
> A few quick questions/remarks:
>
> - Why do you initialize the fracti=
ons in @Before and not @BeforeClass,
> since you don't seem to ever modify =
them?
> - Why assigning them to null in @After?
> - Given the nature of you=
r tests, I would probably use parameterized
> tests to supply only the data=
 that each test needs instead of making these
> eight fields available to a=
ll the test methods all the time.
>
> --
> C=C3=A9dric
>
